japanese: 彼の驚きは大変なものなので、しばらくはものが言えなかった。
english: Such was his surprise that he could not say a word for some time.

japanese: 彼の興奮は容易に説明できる。
english: His excitement is easily accountable.

japanese: 彼の脅しは単なる冗談かと思った。
english: We thought his threat was only a joke.

japanese: 彼の胸は期待に弾んだ。
english: His heart bounded with expectation.

japanese: 彼の教育法には、良い面と悪い面の両方ある。
english: I think his method of teaching cuts both ways.

japanese: 彼の教育についての考え方は間違っている。
english: He is mistaken in his ideas about education.

japanese: 彼の教え子の中でその試験に合格した者はいなかった。
english: Neither of his students passed the exam.

japanese: 彼の教え子の中に、その問題が解けた者は一人もいなかった。
english: None of his students could solve the problem.

japanese: 彼の協力がなかったので我々の計画はだめになった。
english: His lack of cooperation defeated our plan.

japanese: 彼の供述は、実際に起こったことと一致していた。
english: His statement corresponded to what actually took place.

japanese: 彼の供述の真実性は疑わしいと思う。
english: I doubt the veracity of his statement.

japanese: 彼の巨大な体格に僕は自分が小さく思えた。
english: I was dwarfed by his gigantic frame.

japanese: 彼の居場所が分かっていればなあ。
english: I wish I knew where he was!

japanese: 彼の給料は税引きで月に２５万円だ。
english: His salary is 250 thousand yen per month.

japanese: 彼の給料は安すぎて一家を支えていけない。
english: His salary is too low to support his family.

japanese: 彼の給料はいい。
english: He is well paid.

japanese: 彼の給料は７年前の２倍です。
english: His salary is double what it was seven years ago.

japanese: 彼の給料は１０％増えた。
english: His salary was increased by ten percent.

japanese: 彼の給料では裕福になれないだろう。
english: He won't get fat on his salary.

japanese: 彼の給料ではインフレについていけない。
english: His salary can't keep pace with inflation.

japanese: 彼の級友達は彼を見てすぐに笑った。
english: His classmates laughed at him at once.

japanese: 彼の急病で旅行は取りやめになった。
english: His sudden illness deterred us from traveling.

japanese: 彼の丘の上の別荘は、海を見渡している。
english: His villa on the hill commands the sea.

japanese: 彼の議論は問題点から外れていた。
english: His argument was aside from the point.

japanese: 彼の議論は説得力のあるものだったが、私達は彼を支持しなかった。
english: Though his argument was convincing, we did not side with him.

japanese: 彼の議論は事実に基づいたものだった。
english: His argument was based on facts.

japanese: 彼の議論は合理的だ。
english: His argument is rational.

japanese: 彼の議論はわれわれの方針と矛盾している。
english: His argument is inconsistent with our policy.

japanese: 彼の議論はちっとも合理的ではなかった。
english: His argument was far from rational.

japanese: 彼の議論には筋道が無い。
english: I find no logic in his argument.

japanese: 彼の議論にはとても説得力があった。
english: His argument was most convincing.

japanese: 彼の技能はその仕事にうってつけだった。
english: His skills qualified him for the job.

japanese: 彼の技術は独特で、本当に驚くべきものだった。
english: His technique was unique and absolutely amazing.

japanese: 彼の貴族的な作法には感心する。
english: I admire his aristocratic manners.

japanese: 彼の記録は誰も破れない。
english: Nobody can break his record.

japanese: 彼の記録は決して破られないだろう。
english: His record will never be broken.

japanese: 彼の記録は５人の中で一番悪かった。
english: His competition record was the worst among the five.

japanese: 彼の記録は１００メートルの世界新記録だ。
english: His record is a new world record in the 100-meter dash.

japanese: 彼の記憶力は年のせいで衰えてきている。
english: His memory has been decaying because of age.

japanese: 彼の記憶力にはほとほと感心する。
english: His memory amazes me.

japanese: 彼の記憶喪失は物理的な記憶障害というよりは心理的な障害である。
english: His loss of memory is a psychological problem rather than a physical one.

japanese: 彼の気分はよく変わる。
english: His moods often change.

japanese: 彼の気性は手に負えない。
english: He has an uncontrollable temper.

japanese: 彼の気取った話し方がとても滑稽におもえた。
english: His affected manner of speaking seemed very absurd to me.

japanese: 彼の気持ちを変えさせるよう、彼に働きかけねばならない。
english: He must be worked upon so that his feeling may be made to change.

japanese: 彼の気持ちを変えさせようとしたけれど、むだだった。
english: We tried in vain to make him change his mind.

japanese: 彼の気持ちを傷つけたと思う。
english: I think I hurt his feelings.

japanese: 彼の気持ちが分からない。
english: I can't understand his feeling.

japanese: 彼の帰りは遅いと思う。
english: I calculate he will be late coming home.

japanese: 彼の帰りの遅いのが気になる。
english: I wonder why he is late.

japanese: 彼の機嫌をとるのは難しいとわかった。
english: I found it difficult to please him.

japanese: 彼の機嫌がいいことなど滅多にない。
english: He is rarely in a good mood.

japanese: 彼の機嫌が突然変わって、私は大いに当惑された。
english: I was completely bewildered by his sudden change of mood.

japanese: 彼の机の上はものだらけで、書き物をするスペースがなかった。
english: There was so much stuff on his desk that he had nowhere to write.

japanese: 彼は幾分酔っている。
english: He is more or less drunk.

japanese: 彼の希望は無残に砕かれた。
english: His hopes were shattered.

japanese: 彼の企画はむずかしくてたくさんの費用がかかるため、まったく問題外だ。
english: His plan is difficult and expensive; it is completely out of the question.

japanese: 彼の企ては失敗に終わった。
english: His attempt proved to be a failure.

japanese: 彼の企ては結局失敗に終わった。
english: His attempt ended in failure.

japanese: 彼の願望は商売を始める事です。
english: His desire is to go into business.

japanese: 彼の願いはアメリカにいくことです。
english: His wish is to go to America.

japanese: 彼の願いがついに実現した。
english: His wish was realized at last.

japanese: 彼の顔を見るといらいらしているのがわかった。
english: His face showed that he was annoyed.

japanese: 彼の顔を見て、高校時代の友達の１人を思い出した。
english: His face reminded me of one of my friends in my senior high school days.

japanese: 彼の顔を一目見ただけで仕事をやる気がないことがわかった。
english: One glance at his face told me that he was reluctant to work.

japanese: 彼の顔をひっぱたいた。
english: I slapped him in the face.

japanese: 彼の顔は明かりが当らず影になっていた。
english: His face was shadowed from the light.

japanese: 彼の顔は怒りに燃えていた。
english: His face was ablaze with anger.

japanese: 彼の顔は泥まみれだった。
english: His face was covered with mud.

japanese: 彼の顔は多くの人に知られている。
english: His face is known to many people.

japanese: 彼の顔は青くなった。
english: His face turned pale.

japanese: 彼の顔は真っ青になった。
english: His face turned white.

japanese: 彼の顔は情熱の光を放っていた。
english: His face radiated enthusiasm.

japanese: 彼の顔は苦痛でいがんだ。
english: His face was twisted with pain.

japanese: 彼の顔は喜びに輝いていた。
english: His face was alight with joy.

japanese: 彼の顔は喜びで明るくなった。
english: His face lighted up with joy.

japanese: 彼の顔は覚えているんだが、名前を思い出せない。
english: I remember his face but I can't call his name to mind.

japanese: 彼の顔はパッと明るくなった。
english: His face brightened.

japanese: 彼の顔に汗がにじんでいた。
english: The sweat stood on his face.

japanese: 彼の顔に吹き出物ができた。
english: A rash appeared on his face.

japanese: 彼の顔には怒りの気持ちが表れていた。
english: Anger showed on his face.

japanese: 彼の顔には恐怖と不安が浮かんでいた。
english: His face registered fear and anxiety.

japanese: 彼の顔つきを見て私の事で怒っていると思った。
english: I gathered from his looks he was angry with me.

japanese: 彼の顔つきや態度には軽蔑の気持ちが表れていた。
english: His face and attitude showed the scorn he felt.

japanese: 彼の顔つきから判断するとどうも成功したらしい。
english: Judging from the look on his face, it seems that he has succeeded.

japanese: 彼の顔つきからすると今は機嫌が悪い。
english: From the look on his face, he is in a bad mood now.

japanese: 彼の顔からすっかり血の気が引いていった。
english: All the color drained away from his face.

japanese: 彼の頑固な性格を考慮に入れるべきだ。
english: You should reckon with his obstinate character.

japanese: 彼の眼は彼の恐怖心を表わしていた。
english: His eyes betrayed his fear.

japanese: 彼の眼が表情のきびしさをやわらげている。
english: His eyes redeem his face from sternness.

japanese: 彼の観察は正確だ。
english: He is accurate in his observation.

japanese: 彼の観客は最近減ってきている。
english: His audience is falling off these days.

japanese: 彼の甘い口車にのるな。
english: Don't fall for his sugar-coated words.

japanese: 彼の感情を尊重しなさい。
english: Have respect for his feelings.

japanese: 彼の感情を傷付けたくはない。
english: I don't want to hurt his feelings.

japanese: 彼の感情を傷つけるのを恐れて、本当の事を言わなかった。
english: Afraid of hurting his feelings, I didn't tell him the truth.

japanese: 彼の感情を害しないかと心配した。
english: We were afraid that we might hurt him.

japanese: 彼の鞄は水でいっぱいだった。
english: His bag was filled with water.

japanese: 彼の鞄はここにあるから、彼はまだ学校に行ったはずがない。
english: His bag is right here, so he cannot have gone to school yet.

japanese: 彼の鞄が重くて、更に悪いことには、片足のかかとにまめができてしまっていた。
english: His bag was heavy, and what was worse, one of his heels had got blistered.

japanese: 彼の額は汗まみれだった。
english: Sweat bathed his forehead.

japanese: 彼の額の傷痕は目立つ。
english: The scar on his forehead is conspicuous.

japanese: 彼の額の傷は目立つ。
english: The scar on his forehead is conspicuous.

japanese: 彼の額の汗をぬぐった。
english: He wiped the sweat from his forehead.

japanese: 彼の額に玉のような汗が出ていた。
english: Beads of sweat stood on his forehead.

japanese: 彼の額には玉のような汗が浮かんでいた。
english: There were beads of sweat on his forehead.

japanese: 彼の額から汗がどっと流れ出ていた。
english: Sweat was pouring from his brow.

japanese: 彼の学問的な業績には感銘を与えるものがある。
english: His academic achievements are impressive.

japanese: 彼の学説が初めて提唱された時は、誰もそれを信じなかった。
english: When his theory was first put forward, nobody bought it.

japanese: 彼の学校は高い丘の上に立っている。
english: His school stands on a high hill.

japanese: 彼の学校の成績はいい。
english: He has a good school record.

japanese: 彼の概算によると家の新築費用は３０００万円です。
english: He estimates that the new house will cost roughly thirty million yen.

japanese: 彼の外見は幸福そうだが実際はそうではない。
english: He looks wealthy, but actually he's not.

japanese: 彼の外見はすっかり変わってしまったので、おそらく君は彼だとわからないだろう。
english: His appearance has changed so much that you may well not recognize him.

japanese: 彼の外見にだまされた。
english: His appearance deceived me.

japanese: 彼の外見から判断して、彼は金持ちに違いない。
english: Judging from his appearance, he must be a rich man.

japanese: 彼の絵は二科展に入選した。
english: His picture was accepted for the Nika Exhibition.

japanese: 彼の絵は申し分ない。
english: His pictures leave nothing to be desired.

japanese: 彼の絵は私には奇妙に思える。
english: His paintings seem strange to me.

japanese: 彼の絵はとても有名です。
english: His pictures are very famous.

japanese: 彼の絵はとても強い印象を私に与えたので、私は彼に興味を持った。
english: His paintings so impressed me that I was interested in him.

japanese: 彼の絵が壁に飾られていた。
english: His pictures were hung on the wall.

japanese: 彼の絵が入選した。
english: His picture got accepted.

japanese: 彼の回復は全く奇跡も同然であった。
english: His recovery was nothing short of a miracle.

japanese: 彼の回復は見込めない。
english: There is no hope of his recovery.

japanese: 彼の回復の望みはたとえあるにしてもきわめて少ない。
english: There is little, if any, hope of his recovery.

japanese: 彼の回復の望みはあるにしても、ほんの少ししかない。
english: There is little, if any, hope of his recovery.

japanese: 彼の回復の見込みはほとんどありません。
english: There is little hope of his recovery.

japanese: 彼の回復の見込みはない。
english: There is no hope of his recovery.

japanese: 彼の回復の見込みはどうなのか。
english: What are the prospects for his recovery?

japanese: 彼の回復のみこみがあるにしても、ほんの少ししかない。
english: There is little, if any, hope of his recovery.

japanese: 彼の回復に少なからず望みがある。
english: There is not a little hope of his recovery.

japanese: 彼の回復には少なからぬ望みがある。
english: There is not a little hope of his recovery.

japanese: 彼の回答は満足なものとは程遠いものだった。
english: His answer was far from satisfactory.

japanese: 彼の回答に我々がまったく満足しているというわけではない。
english: His answer is not altogether satisfactory to us.

japanese: 彼の回りのすべての物が灰色でした。
english: Everything about him was grey.

japanese: 彼の解説がわかった人はほとんどいなかった。
english: Few people understood his comment.

japanese: 彼の会社は彼が支配している。
english: His company is under his control.

japanese: 彼の解決策は一時的なものだった。
english: His solution was only a temporary one.

japanese: 彼の会社は日本で最もうまく経営されている消費者金融だ。
english: His company is one of the best managed companies in Japan.

japanese: 彼の会社は倒産した。そしてさらに困ったことには、彼自身交通事故に遭ってしまった。
english: His company went bankrupt, and to make matters worse, he met with a traffic accident.

japanese: 彼の会社は地域におけるもっとも成功した小企業として特に選ばれた。
english: His company was singled out as the most successful small business in the region.

japanese: 彼の会社は事業を拡張している。
english: His company is extending its business.

japanese: 彼の会社は自動車の輸出で利益を上げている。
english: His company makes profits from car exports.

japanese: 彼の会社は私の会社のつい目と鼻の先にある。
english: His office is very close to mine.

japanese: 彼の会社に電話したが彼には連絡がとれなかった。
english: I couldn't get hold of him at his office.

japanese: 彼の会社での立場はまずくなりつつある。
english: He is losing ground in his company.

japanese: 彼の会社で作っている機械は私たちの会社のより優れている。
english: Machines that his company produces are superior to ours.

japanese: 彼の会社では外国人労働者が３０パーセントを占めている。
english: Foreign workers make up 30% of his company.

japanese: 彼の会社、最近結構危ない橋を渡っているって、もっぱらの噂だよ。
english: His company is dangling by a thread. That's the rumor I hear.

japanese: 彼の我慢も限界に達した。
english: His patience reached its limit.

japanese: 彼の過失を許した。
english: I pardoned his fault.

japanese: 彼の過去の成功は何にもならない。
english: His past successes count for nothing.

japanese: 彼の過去については何も知りません。
english: I don't know anything as to his past.

japanese: 彼の過ちは大したことはないと見ている。
english: I view his error as insignificant.

japanese: 彼の荷物の底には武器が隠されていた。
english: The weapons were concealed in the bottom of his baggage.

japanese: 彼の歌を聞いた事がある？
english: Have you ever heard him sing?

japanese: 彼の歌は若い人に大いにうけた。
english: His songs were very popular with young people.

japanese: 彼の科学的な発見は多くの謎を解き明かした。
english: His scientific discovery unlocked many mysteries.

japanese: 彼の家族は彼の死について知らされるだろう。
english: His family will be told of his death.

japanese: 彼の家族は彼のわずかな収入で暮らさなければならない。
english: His family has to live on his small income.

japanese: 彼の家族は彼のことを敬愛していた。そしてある意味で彼は彼らに甘やかされていた。
english: His family adored him; in a sense he was spoiled by them.

japanese: 彼の家族は大勢である。
english: His is a large family.

japanese: 彼の家族は畑で働いている。
english: His family works in the fields.

japanese: 彼の家族は大家族だ。
english: His family is large.

japanese: 彼の家族は早起きです。
english: His family are early risers.

japanese: 彼の家族は小麦農家だった。
english: His family had been wheat farmers.

japanese: 彼の家族はみんな元気です。
english: His family are all very well.

japanese: 彼の家族はみな背が高い。
english: His family members are all tall.

japanese: 彼の家族はみな農場で働いている。
english: All of his family work on a farm.

japanese: 彼の家族はかなり生活が苦しい。
english: His family is rather badly off.

japanese: 彼の家族は起きるのが早い。
english: His family are early risers.

japanese: 彼の家族は４０年前に母国からブラジルへ移住しました。
english: His family emigrated from their mother country to Brazil forty years ago.

japanese: 彼の家族の方は異議ありません。
english: It's all right on the part of his family.

japanese: 彼の家族の者たちは皆背が高い。
english: His family members are all tall.

japanese: 彼の家族には何の不自由もない。
english: His family lacks for nothing.

japanese: 彼の家族が一人増えた。
english: There was a new addition to his family.

japanese: 彼の家系は１７世紀にさかのぼる。
english: His family dates back to the seventeenth century.

japanese: 彼の家を訪ねたら、彼は留守だった。
english: When I called at his house, he was absent.

japanese: 彼の家を探して一時間以上も歩き回った。
english: I walked about for over an hour looking for his house.

japanese: 彼の家を見ると彼が貧乏であることがわかる。
english: His house argues him to be poor.

japanese: 彼の家を見つけ出す手だてがない。
english: There's no way to find his house.

japanese: 彼の家を見つけるのに少し苦労した。
english: I had some trouble in finding his house.

japanese: 彼の家を見つけるのに時間がかかった。
english: We had some difficulty finding his house.

japanese: 彼の家を見つけるのに苦労した。
english: I had a hard time finding his house.

japanese: 彼の家を見つけだせなかった。
english: I failed in finding his house.

japanese: 彼の家へ行く道を教えてくれませんか。
english: Will you tell me the way to his house?

japanese: 彼の家へ行くたびに彼はうちにいなかった。
english: Every time I went to his house, he was not at home.

japanese: 彼の家への道を教えて下さい。
english: Will you kindly show me the way to his house?

japanese: 彼の家は辺ぴなところにあった。
english: His house was out of the way.

japanese: 彼の家は富士山の麓にある。
english: His house is at the foot of Mt. Fuji.

japanese: 彼の家は貧しく、貧しい人々はあまり音楽を聞かなかったのです。
english: His family was poor, and poor people did not often hear music.

japanese: 彼の家は売りに出ています。
english: His house is for sale.

japanese: 彼の家は売りに出されている。
english: His house is for sale.

japanese: 彼の家は通りの向こう側にあります。
english: His house is across the street.

japanese: 彼の家は大家族だ。
english: He belongs to a large family.

japanese: 彼の家は全焼した。
english: His house was burnt down.

japanese: 彼の家は川の南側にある。
english: His house is on the south side of the river.

japanese: 彼の家は川のそばに立っている。
english: His house stands by the river.

japanese: 彼の家は小さくて古かった。
english: His house was small and old.

japanese: 彼の家は私の家の３倍の大きさだ。
english: His house is three times larger than mine.

japanese: 彼の家は私の家と比べて小さく見える。
english: His house seems small beside mine.

japanese: 彼の家は私の家と向き合っている。
english: His house confronts mine.

japanese: 彼の家は市の郊外にある。
english: His house is on the skirts of the city.

japanese: 彼の家は今にもつぶれそうなしろものだ。
english: His house is a tumbledown affair.

japanese: 彼の家は見つけやすい。
english: His house is easy to find.

japanese: 彼の家は橋の向こうにあります。
english: His house is on the other side of the bridge.

japanese: 彼の家は丘の中腹にあって、見晴らしがすばらしい。
english: His house stands on the hill-side and commands a splendid view.

japanese: 彼の家は丘の上に立っている。

japanese: 彼の家は丘のふもとのある。

japanese: 彼の家は学校のすぐ近くにある。
english: His house is within a stone's throw of his school.

japanese: 彼の家は何階建てですか。

japanese: 彼の家は駅から歩いてわずかなところだ。
english: His house is within a short walk of the station.

japanese: 彼の家はどこかこの辺りだ。
english: His house is somewhere about here.

japanese: 彼の家はどこかこの辺だ。
english: His house is somewhere about here.

japanese: 彼の家はちょうど郵便局の真向かいにある。
english: His house is just across from the post office.

japanese: 彼の家はちょうど道路の向かい側です。
english: His house is just over the road.

japanese: 彼の家はたくさんの高いビルに囲まれている立っている。
english: His house stands by a lot of tall buildings.

japanese: 彼の家はその川の土手にある。
english: His house is on the bank of the river.

japanese: 彼の家はこの店から遠くありません。
english: His house isn't far from this store.

japanese: 彼の家はこの通りの向こうにあります。
english: His house is on the opposite side of the street.

japanese: 彼の家はこの辺りだよ。
english: His house is somewhere about here.

japanese: 彼の家はここから遠くない。
english: His house is not far from here.

japanese: 彼の家はいろいろと便利だ。
english: His house is full of convenience.

japanese: 彼の家は４番街のあたりにある。
english: His house is somewhere about Fourth Street.

japanese: 彼の家は１万ドルで売られた。
english: His house was sold for $10,000.

japanese: 彼の家は２軒先です。
english: He lives two doors off.

japanese: 彼の家の裏手には広い庭がある。
english: There is a large garden at the back of his house.

japanese: 彼の家の毎月の収入は８００ドルです。
english: His family has 800 dollars coming in every month.

japanese: 彼の家の前には松の木が立っている。
english: A pine stands in front of his house.

japanese: 彼の家に雷が落ちた。
english: His house was struck by lightning.

japanese: 彼の家の近くには病院がない。
english: There are no hospitals in the vicinity of his house.

japanese: 彼の家に不幸があった。
english: There's been a death in his family.

japanese: 彼の家に寄ってみよう。
english: Let's call at his house.

japanese: 彼の家と私の家は目と鼻の先です。
english: He lives within earshot of my house.

japanese: 彼の家が燃えていた。
english: His house was on fire.

japanese: 彼の家が先週泥棒にはいられた。
english: His house was broken into by burglars last week.

japanese: 彼の家が火事であるのを見つけた。
english: I found that his house was on fire.

japanese: 彼の化学の講義は苦痛以外のなにものでもなかった。
english: His lecture on chemistry was nothing but torture.

japanese: 彼の化けの皮をはごうとしたが、むりだった。
english: I tried in vain to catch him out.

japanese: 彼の下手な歌は、生徒全員に笑われた。
english: His poor song was laughed at by all the students.

japanese: 彼の下で働くのでは満足できなかった。
english: I wasn't content to work under him.

japanese: 彼の下で働くなら辞めた方がましだ。
english: I would rather quit than work under him.

japanese: 彼の下で働くぐらいなら私はむしろ餓死する。
english: I would rather starve than work under him.

japanese: 彼の音楽熱はいつまでもさめない。
english: Music is his abiding passion.

japanese: 彼の音楽は本国では人気がなかった。
english: His music was not popular at home.

japanese: 彼の音楽は若者に受ける。
english: His music appeals to young people.

japanese: 彼の音楽は海外で大変な人気を獲得した。
english: His music has attained great popularity overseas.

japanese: 彼の音楽はやかましすぎるよ。
english: His music is too noisy.

japanese: 彼の音楽の才能はウィーンではぐくまれた。
english: His musical ability was fostered in Vienna.

japanese: 彼の音楽の好みは素晴らしい。
english: His taste in music is superb.

japanese: 彼の音楽と言葉は若者に受ける。
english: His music and words appeal to young people.

japanese: 彼の音楽が全国で大流行している。
english: His music is sweeping the whole country.

japanese: 彼の横暴ぶりは目に余った。
english: His tyrannies were beyond endurance.

japanese: 彼の横柄な態度にはもう我慢ならない。
english: His arrogance is no longer tolerable.

japanese: 彼の奥さんは彼が行くところは何処でもついていきます。
english: His wife goes with him wherever he goes.

japanese: 彼の奥さんはフランス人です。
english: His wife is French.

japanese: 彼の奥さんは外国人らしい。
english: His wife seems to be foreign.

japanese: 彼の奥さんはなかなかの才女だ。
english: His wife is quite a talented woman.

japanese: 彼の奥さんはどんな人？
english: What is his wife like?

japanese: 彼の奥さんには駅であったのだが、とても魅力的な人だね。
english: His wife whom I met at the station, is very attractive.

japanese: 彼の甥は謙虚で思いやりのある人になるように育てられた。
english: His nephew was brought up to be modest and considerate.

japanese: 彼の鉛筆は先がとがっている。
english: His pencil has a sharp point.

japanese: 彼の煙草の火で彼女の服に穴をあけた。
english: His cigarette burned a hole in her dress.

japanese: 彼の演奏は目を見張るものであった。
english: His performance was amazing.

japanese: 彼の演奏は申し分なかった。
english: His performance left nothing to be desired.

japanese: 彼の演奏は賞賛に値するものだった。
english: His performance was worthy of praise.

japanese: 彼の演奏は少しもよくなかったと思う。
english: I don't think that his performance was any good.

japanese: 彼の演説中に不思議な出来事が起こった。
english: A strange incident happened during his speech.

japanese: 彼の演説を録音しておかねばならない。

japanese: 彼の演説は聞く価値がある。
english: His speech is worth listening to.

japanese: 彼の演説は党の意向を反映したものではなかった。

japanese: 彼の演説は聴衆を飽かせなかった。

japanese: 彼の演説は聴衆の好評を博した。

japanese: 彼の演説は抽象的なので私には理解できない。
english: His speech is too abstract to understand.

japanese: 彼の演説は短くて要点をついていた。
english: His speech was brief and to the point.

japanese: 彼の演説は大変感動的だった。君も行けばよかったのに。
english: His speech was very impressive. You should have been there.

japanese: 彼の演説は耐えられないほど退屈であった。
english: His speech was intolerably dull.

japanese: 彼の演説は絶大なる拍手かっさいを博した。

japanese: 彼の演説は政府の政策の効果的な擁護論であった。

japanese: 彼の演説は私達の感情に影響を与えた。

japanese: 彼の演説は私達にとても感銘を与えた。

japanese: 彼の演説は私によい印象を与えた。

japanese: 彼の演説は最初のところが少し理解できたが、残りはちんぷんかんぷんだった。

japanese: 彼の演説は国中どこでも大聴衆に歓迎された。
english: His speeches were welcomed by large audiences all over the country.

japanese: 彼の演説は気迫に欠けていた。

japanese: 彼の演説は簡潔で要を得たものだった。

japanese: 彼の演説は簡潔スピーチです。
english: His address is a concise speech.

japanese: 彼の演説は我々の注意を引いた。

japanese: 彼の演説はまんざら捨てたものではなかった。

japanese: 彼の演説はとても説得力がある。
english: His speech is very eloquent.

japanese: 彼の演説はあまりにも短すぎた。
english: His speech was too short.

japanese: 彼の演説は３時間も続いた。
english: His speech continued for three hours.

japanese: 彼の演説は、たいへんまずかった。
english: His speech was very poor.

japanese: 彼の演説の要約が新聞に載せられた。
english: A summary of his speech was printed in the newspaper.

japanese: 彼の演説の意味がわからなかった。

japanese: 彼の演説には内容がほとんどなかった。

japanese: 彼の演説には数々のすばらしい言い回しが含まれていた。

english: His acting is far from being perfect.

japanese: 彼の演技は期待に添わなかった。
english: His performance fell short of expectations.

japanese: 彼の演技は完璧だった。
english: His acting left nothing to be desired.

japanese: 彼の演技は格好の批判の対象だった。
english: His performance was fair game for criticism.

japanese: 彼の援助なしでもやっていける。

japanese: 彼の援助を当てにしてはならない。

japanese: 彼の援助を当てにしてはいけません。

japanese: 彼の援助を期待するな。

japanese: 彼の援助をあてにするな。

japanese: 彼の援助は非常に貴重なものであった。

japanese: 彼の援助は当てに出来ない。

japanese: 彼の影響力は未だ衰えていない。

english: I know of him, but I don't know him personally.

japanese: 彼の嘘が事態を複雑にした。
english: His lie complicated matters.

japanese: 彼の右足はしびれていた。
english: His right leg was asleep.

japanese: 彼の飲酒癖は今に始まったことではない。
english: His drinking habit is an old one.

japanese: 彼の一番の魅力は容貌にではなく、性格にある。

japanese: 彼の一生は変化に富んだものだった。

japanese: 彼の一生は波瀾万丈であった。

english: All his hopes evaporated when he lost his only son in the war.

japanese: 彼の一人息子が、彼の全財産を相続した。

japanese: 彼の一家は、郊外の新しい家に引っ越した。

japanese: 彼の医者は彼にアルコール類は飲むなと命じた。

japanese: 彼の遺族は妻と娘１人である。

japanese: 彼の遺骨はここに埋められている。

japanese: 彼の衣服は着古されている。

japanese: 彼の意地の悪い発言で、講義が一層激しくなった。

japanese: 彼の意志は弟に伝えられた。

japanese: 彼の意志の力によって勝利をおさめた。

japanese: 彼の意向に逆らうな。

japanese: 彼の意見をきくのも悪くはないでしょう。

japanese: 彼の意見は本当に場違いだった。
english: His remark was really out of line.

japanese: 彼の意見は保守的傾向を帯びている。
english: His opinion inclines towards the conservative.

japanese: 彼の意見は変化しやすい。

japanese: 彼の意見は彼女のものとは違う。
english: He differs in opinion from her.

japanese: 彼の意見は馬鹿げて聞こえます。
english: His ideas sound crazy.

japanese: 彼の意見は道理にかなっている。
english: His opinion is reasonable.

japanese: 彼の意見は同僚の間でなんの共鳴も呼ばない。
english: His opinion does not arouse any sympathy in his colleagues.

japanese: 彼の意見は適切だと思った。
english: I thought his remarks very apropos.

japanese: 彼の意見は大変重要だと思います。
english: I think his opinion is of great importance.

japanese: 彼の意見は多分通るだろう。
english: His opinion will probably be accepted.

japanese: 彼の意見は大体において正しい。
english: His opinion is generally correct.

japanese: 彼の意見は全く正しい。
english: His opinion is quite just.

japanese: 彼の意見は重要ではない。

japanese: 彼の意見は受け入れられなかった。
english: His opinion was not accepted.

japanese: 彼の意見は私のと相反している。
english: His opinion is in conflict with mine.

japanese: 彼の意見は私のと合わない。
english: His opinion comes into conflict with mine.

japanese: 彼の意見は私のと一致している。
english: His views are in accord with mine.

japanese: 彼の意見は私のと違う。
english: His opinion is different from mine.

japanese: 彼の意見は控え目である。
english: He is humble about his opinion.

japanese: 彼の意見は結局私の計画はだめだという非難であった。
english: His remarks added up to a condemnation of my plan.

japanese: 彼の意見は完全に的はずれだった。
english: His opinion was completely beside the point.

japanese: 彼の意見は我々の意見とはまったく違っている。
english: His opinion is quite different from ours.

japanese: 彼の意見は我々のと一致している。
english: His opinions are in accord with ours.

japanese: 彼の意見はたいへん論理的である。
english: His view is quite logical.

japanese: 彼の意見はその問題に新しい見方を加える。
english: His opinion adds a new light to the question.

japanese: 彼の意見はくだらない。
english: His opinion is for the birds.

japanese: 彼の意見はいつも役に立たない。
english: His opinion is always of no use.

japanese: 彼の意見はある程度正しい。

japanese: 彼の意見は、あまり重要ではなかった。
english: His opinion was unimportant.

japanese: 彼の意見に反対する人もいる。

japanese: 彼の意見には強い影響力がある。
english: His ideas carry a lot of weight.

japanese: 彼の意見に賛成です。

japanese: 彼の意見には偏見がない。
english: His opinion is free from prejudice.

japanese: 彼の意見には重みがある。
english: His opinions carry weight.

japanese: 彼の意見と私たちの意見は少しも違いはないと思う。
english: I do not suspect that his opinion is any different from ours.

japanese: 彼の意見が選挙区民には直接の影響を待たなかったことを付け加えておくべきであろう。
english: It should be added that his remarks had no direct influence on the constituency.

japanese: 彼の偉大な才能は友達がその真価を認めていた。
english: His great ability was fully appreciated by his friends.

japanese: 彼の偉大な学識はついに認められた。

japanese: 彼の案は現実離れしすぎていて、我々にとって実用的ではない。
english: His idea is too abstract to be of practical use to us.

japanese: 彼の安否が気がかりだ。
english: I'm anxious about his safety.

japanese: 彼の安定的な支持が無ければ、私の事業は失敗に終わっていただろう。
english: But for his steady support, my venture would have resulted in a failure.

japanese: 彼の悪口を言わないで。
english: Don't call him names.

japanese: 彼の悪口をいっても何もならない。
english: There is no sense in speaking ill of him.

english: I will cure him of the bad habit.

japanese: 彼の悪い成績は勉強不足の結果かも知れない。
english: His poor grades may come from lack of study.

english: His affection is cooling.

japanese: 彼の愛は冷めていった。
english: His love grew cold.

japanese: 彼の愛と取り替えられるものは何もなかった。
english: Nothing replaced his love.

japanese: 彼のわずかな稼ぎで暮らしていくのは困難だった。
english: It was difficult to live on his meager earnings.

japanese: 彼のわざとらしい話し方が嫌いだ。
english: I don't like his affected manner of speaking.

japanese: 彼のワゴンがマーケットの入り口で止まった。
english: His wagon drew up at the entrance to the market.

english: Nothing vexed her more than his selfishness.

japanese: 彼のわがままは大変なもので誰からも好かれなかった。
english: His selfishness was such that nobody liked him.

japanese: 彼のわがままにも困ったものだ。
english: I'm annoyed at his selfishness.

english: His report has just been handed in.

english: His lighter has done ten years' service.

japanese: 彼のような有能な人物が成功しても不思議ではない。
english: It is no wonder that a man of his ability is successful.

japanese: 彼のような有能な人が成功しても不思議でない。
english: It is no wonder that a man of his ability is successful.

japanese: 彼のような偏屈を理解するには一生かかるよ。
english: It will take you a whole lifetime to understand a crank like him.

japanese: 彼のような能力のある人が成功をおさめるのは当然のことだ。
english: It is no wonder that a man of his ability is so successful.

english: We shall not see his like again.

japanese: 彼のような勤勉な男は必ず成功するだろう。
english: Such a diligent man as he is sure to succeed.

english: Such an alert man as he couldn't have failed to adapt himself to the new situation.

japanese: 彼のようなタイプの男性は嫌いだ。
english: I don't go for men of his type.

japanese: 彼のよい振る舞いに最も強い印象を受けた。
english: I was most impressed by his good behavior.

english: This is a historical examination of the birth of his unique architectural style.

japanese: 彼のユーモアのセンスは非常によい。
english: He has a very good sense of humor.

japanese: 彼のユーモアにつられて拍手喝采が起こった。
english: His infectious humor stimulated applause.

english: His way of doing things was much disliked.

japanese: 彼のやっている事を知ったのは全くの偶然だった。
english: It was entirely by chance that I found out what he was doing.

japanese: 彼のやったことには何か理由があるに違いない。
english: There must be some reason for what he has done.

english: He did a real snow job on my daughter.

japanese: 彼のめがねにかなう女性はいなかった。
english: No woman could measure up to his standard.

japanese: 彼のメールアドレスは hirosey@genet.co.jp です。
english: His e-mail address is hirosey@genet.co.jp.

english: Can you establish his innocence?

japanese: 彼のむすこには音楽の才能がある。
english: His son has a gift for music.

japanese: 彼のみたまが天国で安らかなることを。
english: May his soul rest in Heaven.

japanese: 彼のミスがその計画を水泡に帰した。
english: His error brought the project to nothing.

japanese: 彼のマネジメント能力は高く評価されている。
english: He's well respected for his management skills.

japanese: 彼のまぬけな返答を聞いてみんなびっくりした。
english: His stupid answer surprised everybody.

japanese: 彼のマナーは感じのよいものとはとても言えなかった。
english: His manners were far from pleasant.

japanese: 彼のマナーの悪さには参ったよ。
english: I was embarrassed by his bad manners.

japanese: 彼のマナーが悪いのは幼少時代のしつけが足りなかったせいだと彼らは考えた。
english: They attributed his bad manners to lack of training in childhood.

japanese: 彼のまじめさがかえってマイナスになった。
english: His diligence turned out a disadvantage after all.

japanese: ポケットの中にはお金が入っていない。
english: I have no money in my pocket.

japanese: 彼のほかはみんな九州の出身である。
english: Everyone but him comes from Kyushu.

japanese: 彼のほかに私たち皆が行った。
english: All of us went besides him.

japanese: 彼のボールさばきは魔術に近い。
english: His handling of the ball borders on wizardry.

japanese: 彼のホームランは観衆を沸かせた。
english: The spectators were excited by his home run.

japanese: 彼のほおの傷あとは今ではほとんどわからない。
english: The scar on his cheek hardly shows now.

japanese: 彼のほうに分がある。
english: The odds are in his favor.

japanese: 彼のほうには何の間違いもなかった。
english: There was no mistake on his part.

japanese: 彼のほうには異議はなかった。
english: There was no objection on his part.

japanese: 彼のほうが私より段違いにうまい。
english: He can do it far better than I can.

japanese: 彼のほうが兄より背が高い。
english: He is taller than his brother.

japanese: 彼のプロジェクトは助成金でまかなわれていた。
english: His project was funded by grants.

japanese: 彼のプレゼントを楽しみにしているの。
english: I'm looking forward to his present.

japanese: 彼のふるまいを見たらむかむかした。
english: I felt disgust at his behavior.

japanese: 彼のふるまいは本当に私の神経にさわった。
english: His behavior really got on my nerves.

japanese: 彼のふるまいは世間の称賛を浴びた。
english: His behavior won general applause.

japanese: 彼のふるまいはとても丁寧とは言えなかった。
english: His behavior was anything but polite.

japanese: 彼のふるまいはいつも立派だ。
english: His behavior is always honorable.

japanese: 彼のふるまいから彼が嘘をついているのは明らかだ。
english: It is evident from his behavior that he lies.

japanese: 彼のフランス語の知識は未熟だ。
english: His knowledge of French is poor.

japanese: 彼のプライドはわずかだが傷ついた。
english: His pride was slightly touched.

japanese: 彼のぶしつけな質問に少女は当惑した様子だった。
english: The girl looked embarrassed at his rude question.

japanese: 彼のふしだらな行為は気付かれずにはすまなかった。
english: His immoral actions did not go unnoticed.

japanese: 彼のピンクのタキシードには、みんな笑った。
english: We all laughed at his pink tuxedo.

japanese: 彼のひまな講演のあいだずっと私は眠っていた。
english: I slept through his dull speech.

japanese: 彼のひどい遅刻に腹が立った。
english: I was annoyed with him for being so late.

japanese: 彼のビジネスプランは立派だけど、勘定あって銭足らず、という気もするけどね。
english: His business plan looks good on paper but I get the feeling it would never work in practice.

japanese: 彼のピアノ演奏はすばらしい響きがした。
english: His piano playing sounded fantastic.

japanese: 彼のピアノの腕前は上がってきている。
english: He is making good progress in playing the piano.

japanese: 彼のは悪文だ。
english: He has a bad style.

japanese: 彼のパリ行きの目的は大統領と会見することであった。
english: His object in traveling to Paris was to meet with the President.

japanese: 彼のばかげた提案が満場一致で承認された。
english: His foolish proposal was approved unanimously.

japanese: 彼のはいっている寮は食事が大変よい。
english: The food is very good in the dormitory where he lives.

japanese: 彼のバイクはガードレールに衝突した。
english: His bike ran into a guard-rail.

japanese: 彼のバイオリンの保険料は年額２００ドルだ。
english: The insurance on his violin costs $200 a year.

japanese: 彼のねらいが何だかわかってきた。
english: I began to see what he was getting at.

japanese: 彼のネクタイがほどけた。
english: His tie came undone.

japanese: 彼のなまりから考えれば、九州出身に違いない。
english: Judging from his accent, he must be from Kyushu.

japanese: 彼のなまりから外国人だとわかる。
english: His accent suggests he is a foreigner.

japanese: 彼のドジ話を聞いて、皆、抱腹絶倒した。

japanese: 彼のところを訪ねる前に、彼が家にいるかどうか確かめた方がいいよ。
english: You had better make sure that he is at home, before you call on him.

japanese: 彼のところへ行くたびに彼は勉強していた。
english: Each time I went to see him, I found him at work.

japanese: 彼のところでちょうど２０年勤続した。
english: I have been in his employ for exactly twenty years.

japanese: 彼のデザインは大変独創的だ。
english: His designs are highly original.

japanese: 彼のテーブルマナーはひどいものだ。
english: He has atrocious table manners.

japanese: 彼のつなぎ服はペンキのしみだらけだった。
english: His overall was covered with paint-stains.

japanese: 彼のつかの間の休息は彼女がきて中断された。
english: His brief repose was interrupted by her arrival.

japanese: 彼のそれのやり方を知っていますか。

japanese: 彼のその論文は環境問題を扱っている。
english: That paper of his deal with environmental problems.

japanese: 彼のその勇気は激賞に値する。
english: His courage is worthy of high praise.

japanese: 彼のその言葉をとても小さな声で言った。
english: He said the words in a very small voice.

japanese: 彼のそのような行動が彼女の両親の疑念を生んだ。
english: Such conduct on his part gave rise to her parents' suspicion.

japanese: 彼のせりふは割り引いて聞いてよ。単に売り言葉に買い言葉というだけなんだから。
english: Don't let what he said get to you. He was just getting back at you for what you said.

japanese: 彼のぜいたくぶりは収入と不釣り合いである。
english: His extravagance is out of proportion to his wage.

japanese: 彼のスラックスはしわくちゃだ。
english: His slacks are all wrinkled.

japanese: 彼のズボンのしりはてかてか光っている。
english: The seat of his pants is shiny.

japanese: 彼のすべての疑いは晴れた。
english: He was purged of all suspicion.

japanese: 彼のスピーチは面白かった。
english: The content of his speech was interesting.

japanese: 彼のスピーチは彼らを感動させ涙を流させた。
english: His speech moved them to tears.

japanese: 彼のスピーチは短くて要領を得ていた。
english: His speech was short and to the point.

japanese: 彼のスピーチは心を打った。
english: His speech appealed to us.

japanese: 彼のスピーチは私を退屈にさせた。
english: His speech bored me.

japanese: 彼のスピーチは延々と続いた。
english: His speech went on and on.

japanese: 彼のスピーチの内容はとても良かった。
english: The content of his speech was very good.

japanese: 彼のスピーチの主旨を教えてください。
english: Tell me the substance of his speech.

japanese: 彼のスピーチに失望しました。
english: I was disappointed with his speech.

japanese: 彼のすばらしい作品は際だっている。
english: His excellent work stands out.

japanese: 彼のステージはどれも目を見張るものばかりだ。
english: He's really something to see every time he gets up on stage.

japanese: 彼のすぐれたシンフォニーが演奏された。
english: His great symphony was performed.

japanese: 彼のスキーヤーとしての優秀性は十分に買っています。
english: We fully appreciate his excellence as a skier.

japanese: 彼のスキーの腕前は私たちの称賛の的です。
english: His skill at skiing is the admiration of us.

japanese: 彼のスキーの腕は私よりはるかに上だ。
english: He is far above me in skiing.

japanese: 彼のシャツは灰色でネクタイは黄色だった。
english: His shirt was gray and his tie was yellow.

japanese: 彼のジョークを聞いて笑わずにはいられなかった。
english: I couldn't help laughing at his joke.

japanese: 彼のジョークを聞いて思わず笑ってしまった。
english: I could not help laughing at his jokes.

japanese: 彼のジョークは最高だ。
english: His joke killed me.

japanese: 彼のジョークはいつも退屈だ。
english: His jokes are always flat.

japanese: 彼のジョークにみんな笑わずにはいられなかった。
english: Everybody could not help laughing at his joke.

japanese: 彼のジョークに笑ったよ。
english: His joke killed me.

japanese: 彼のジョークではいつもみんなが笑うとは限らない。
english: Some people laugh at his jokes, but others don't.

japanese: 彼のしゃべりかたは生徒には速すぎた。
english: He spoke too fast for the student.

japanese: 彼のシャツにはソースのしみがついていた。
english: His shirt was stained with sauce.

japanese: 彼のしたことは間違っていない。
english: What he did is not wrong.

japanese: 彼のしたことはひとの道を踏み外したものだ。
english: What he did was against humanity.

japanese: 彼のコンサートは聴く価値がある。
english: It is worthwhile listening to his concert.

japanese: 彼のコンサートは最高だった。
english: His concert was unreal.

japanese: 彼のコンサートにはたくさんの人が集まった。
english: His concert attracted many people.

japanese: 彼のコンサートでは、彼女は離れたところから歓声を上げています。
english: At his concerts, she screams for him from a distance.

japanese: 彼のこの本は全然おもしろくありません。
english: This book of his isn't interesting at all.

japanese: 彼のこの発明はとても貴重なものだと分かった。
english: This invention of his proved to be of great value.

japanese: 彼のことを話してよ。
english: Tell me about him.

japanese: 彼のこの十年間の経歴には問題はない。
english: He has had a clean record for the past ten years.

japanese: 彼のことを同情せずにはいられない。
english: I cannot but feel sorry for him.

japanese: 彼のことを知れば知るほどいっそう彼のことが好きになる。
english: The more you know about him, the more you like him.

japanese: 彼のことを笑わざるを得ない。
english: I cannot help laughing at him.

japanese: 彼のことを笑ってはいけない。

japanese: 彼のことを仕事の虫だと言うけれど、仕事をしているときが一番楽しいという人間もいるんだよ。
english: You say he is a workaholic, but you know there are some people who feel happiest when they're working.

japanese: 彼のことを公平に言うなら、彼は常識のある人だ。
english: To do him justice, he is a man of common sense.

japanese: 彼のことを公平にいうなら、彼は正直なのだ。
english: To do him justice, he is honest.

japanese: 彼のことを誤解していたのだと私は気づき始めた。
english: It gradually dawned on me that I had misunderstood him.

japanese: 彼のことを気の毒に思わずにはいられなかった。
english: I could not help feeling sorry for him.

japanese: 彼のことをアメリカ人だと思ったがイギリス人だった。
english: I thought he was an American but he turned out to be an Englishman.

japanese: 彼のことは名前だけは知っています。
english: I just know his name, that's all.

japanese: 彼のことは無視していなさい。
english: Do not take any notice of him.

japanese: 彼のことは長い間知っていますから、彼が正直であることは保証します。
english: I can answer for his honesty, since I have known him for a long time.

japanese: 彼のことは信じてる。
english: I believe in him.

japanese: 彼のことは会えば会釈する程度に知っています。
english: I have a nodding acquaintance with him.

japanese: 彼のことはまったく知りません。
english: I don't know anything about him at all.

japanese: 彼のことはほとんど心配するほどのことは無い。
english: It's hardly worthwhile worrying about him.

japanese: 彼のことばの魔力が聴衆を魅了した。
english: The magic of his words attracted the audience.

japanese: 彼のことばに彼女が腹を立てているのも無理はない。
english: She may well be angry at his remark.

japanese: 彼のことはこれ以上知りません。顔を合わせれば会釈する程度の知り合いですから。
english: I don't know any more about him. I know him, but only to say hello to.

japanese: 彼のことについて私は何も知りません。
english: I don't know anything about him at all.

japanese: 彼のことがわからなくなることがときどきあります。
english: At times I can't understand him.

japanese: 彼のぐちにはきりがない。
english: There is no end to his complaining.

japanese: 彼のくしゃみで私たちの会話が中断した。
english: Our conversation was interrupted by his sneezes.

japanese: 彼のくしゃみが私達の会話の邪魔をした。
english: Our conversation was interrupted by his sneezes.

japanese: 彼のきのうの欠席は風邪によるものだった。
english: His absence yesterday was due to his cold.

japanese: 彼のきざな態度は頭にくる。
english: His affectations are annoying.

japanese: 彼のカメラの値段は僕のカメラの値段の３倍だ。
english: His camera is three times as expensive as mine.

japanese: 彼のお母さんは彼が一人でそこへ行くことには賛成しないだろう。
english: His mother will not consent to his going there alone.

japanese: 彼のお母さんは年のわりには若く見える。
english: His mother looks young for her age.

japanese: 彼のお母さんは英語の先生だ。
english: His mother is an English teacher.

japanese: 彼のお母さんは以前歌手だった。
english: His mother used to be a singer.

japanese: 彼のお母さんはそのことで絶えず愚痴をこぼしています。
english: His mother is constantly complaining about it.

japanese: 彼のお父さんは彼をトムと呼んでいる。
english: His father calls him Tom.

japanese: 彼のお父さんは今入院中だそうです。
english: It is said that his father is in hospital now.

japanese: 彼のお父さんは外国にいるそうだ。
english: I hear that his father is abroad.

japanese: 彼のお父さんは外国で死んだのだそうだ。
english: It is said that his father died in a foreign country.

japanese: 彼のお父さんはゴルフをしません。
english: His father doesn't play golf.

japanese: 彼のお父さんは、彼の帰省後亡くなった。
english: His father died after his return home.

japanese: 彼のお世辞にはだれものらない。
english: No one will be caught by his flattery.

japanese: 彼のお兄さんは先月亡くなった。
english: His brother passed away last month.

japanese: 彼のお金は全部なくなっていた。
english: His money was all gone.

japanese: 彼のおもみで氷が割れた。
english: The ice gave way under his weight.

japanese: 彼の叔母さんは若く見える。
english: His aunt looks young.

japanese: 彼の叔母が日中彼の犬の世話をしている。
english: His aunt takes care of his dog during the day.

japanese: 彼のおばあさんは元気そうです。
english: His grandmother looks healthy.

japanese: 彼のおどしなどちっともこわくない。
english: I am not in the least afraid of his threats.

japanese: 彼のおじさんは五年前に亡くなったよ。
english: His uncle died five years ago.

japanese: 彼のおじさんは１週間前商用でヨーロッパに出かけ、今ロンドンかパリにいる。
english: His uncle went to Europe on business a week ago and he is now either in London or in Paris.

japanese: 彼のおじが彼の責任を負うだろう。
english: His uncle will undertake the responsibility for him.

japanese: 彼のおじいさんは何歳かしら。
english: How old might his grandfather be?

japanese: 彼のおじいさんはいわゆる独立独行の人だ。
english: His grandfather is what is called a self-made man.

japanese: 彼のおじいさんは５年ぐらい前に気が触れてしまった。
english: His grandfather went off the deep end about five years ago.

japanese: 彼のおじいさんは１年前に、ガンで亡くなった。
english: His grandfather died of cancer a year ago.

japanese: 彼のおかげで彼の負債１００万円を払うはめになった。
english: He stuck me with debts of 1,000,000 yen.

japanese: 彼のおかげで就職できた。
english: Thanks to him, I could get a job.

japanese: 彼のおかげで取引がダメになった。
english: He blew the deal.

japanese: 彼のオーバーは擦り切れている。
english: His overcoat is worn out.

japanese: 彼のオートバイは最新モデルだ。
english: His motorcycle is the latest model.

japanese: 彼のおいはその壮観な花火に心を奪われた。
english: His nephew was absorbed in the splendid fireworks.

japanese: 彼のえりのサイズはいくつですか。
english: What size of collar does he take?

japanese: 彼のエラーがなかったなら我々は勝てたのだが。
english: If it had not been for his error, we would have won.

japanese: 彼のうわさを聞きましたか。
english: Did you hear of him?

japanese: 彼のうるさい小言に彼女は悩まされた。
english: His nagging distressed her.

japanese: 彼のうちは大家族だ。
english: His family is very large.

japanese: 彼のいんぎんさは本心ではないかもしれない。
english: His cordiality may not be authentic.

japanese: 彼のいる家は嫌いだ。
english: I don't like the house in which he lives.

japanese: 彼のいないところで彼の悪口を言うな。
english: Don't speak ill of him in his absence.

japanese: 彼のいっていることは筋が通らない。
english: What he's saying just isn't consistent.

japanese: 彼が言っていることは、この問題と何の関係もない。
english: What he says has nothing to do with this problem.

japanese: 彼のいった事がまだよく分からない。
english: What he said is still unclear to me.

japanese: 彼のいっていることに何か有利な証拠がありますか。
english: Is there any evidence that supports his position?

japanese: 彼の言ったことは名案だ。
english: What he said is a good idea.

japanese: 彼が言ったことは本当であるはずが無い。
english: What he said cannot be true.

japanese: 彼のいったことはこの場合当てはまらない。
english: What he said doesn't apply in this situation.

japanese: 彼のいったことはいくつかの意味に解釈できます。
english: What he said is capable of several interpretations.

japanese: 彼の一生は社会の下積みで終わった。
english: He lived and died in obscurity.

japanese: 彼のいちだは向かい風のため、余り伸びなかった。
english: His shot didn't carry well against the wind.

japanese: 彼のいう事は理解できない。
english: I can't make him out.

japanese: 鈴木さんはトムのいたずらにご立腹だ。
english: Mr. Suzuki is angry about Tom's prank.

japanese: 彼のいう事は要領を得ている。
english: What he says is brief and to the point.

japanese: 彼のいう事は簡にして要を得た。
english: What he said was brief and to the point.

japanese: 彼の言う事がほとんど聞こえなかった。
english: I could hardly hear him.

japanese: 彼のいうことはまったく意味を成さない。
english: What he says makes no sense at all.

japanese: 彼のいうことは、私の想定の裏付けとなる。
english: What he said bears out my assumption.

japanese: 彼のいうところによれば、彼女は正直な女だ。
english: According to him, she is honest.

japanese: 彼のいいところを引き出すようにしなさい。
english: Try to bring out the best in him.

japanese: 彼のあんな振る舞いは許せない。
english: I can't forgive him for behaving like that.

japanese: 彼のあわれな犬はまだ生きている。
english: His poor dog is still alive.

japanese: 彼のアリバイは完璧に見えた。
english: His alibi seemed cast-iron.

japanese: 彼のアリバイには疑わしいところはない。
english: His alibi is above suspicion.

japanese: 彼のあらゆる努力は実を結ばなかった。
english: All his endeavors proved unsuccessful.

japanese: 彼のあの話はまゆつばものだ。
english: That story of his sounds very unlikely.

japanese: 彼のあの態度には耐えられない。
english: I can't stand that attitude of his.

japanese: 彼のあのおじさんはたびたびアメリカを訪れたことがある。
english: That uncle of his often visited America.

japanese: 彼のアドバイスはどれもあまり役に立たなかった。
english: None of his advice was very useful.

japanese: 彼のアドバイスのおかげで成功した。
english: It was thanks to his advice that I succeeded.

japanese: 彼のアドバイスのおかげで、私はもう一度やってみようという気になった。
english: His advice encouraged me to try it again.

japanese: 彼のアドバイスで考えを変える気になった。
english: His advice inclined me to change my mind.

japanese: 彼のあつかましさはもうたくさんだ。
english: I've had quite enough of his impudence.

japanese: 彼のあだ名は言い得て妙だよね。
english: That nickname fits him perfectly.

japanese: 彼のあごを殴ってやった。
english: I hit him on the chin.

japanese: 彼のあごから彼が父親似である事が分かる。
english: You can see from his chin that takes after his father.

japanese: 彼のアクセントから判断すると、彼は関西の出身だ。
english: Judging from his accent, he is from Kansai.

japanese: 彼のアイデアは全く価値がない。
english: His idea counts for nothing.

japanese: 彼のアイデアは私の理解を越えている。
english: His idea is beyond the reach of my understanding.

japanese: 彼のアイデアの方が君のものより優れている。
english: His idea is superior to yours.

japanese: 彼の７０歳の誕生日を祝ってパーティーを開いた。
english: We gave a party in celebration of his 70th birthday.

japanese: 彼の７０歳の誕生日のお祝いにパーティーを開いた。
english: We gave a party in celebration of his 70th birthday.

japanese: 彼の２人の娘のうち１人は東京に、もう１人は奈良に住んでいる。
english: One of his two daughters lives in Tokyo, and the other in Nara.

japanese: 彼の２人の息子は父親の家が欲しかった。
english: His two sons wanted their father's house.

japanese: 彼の、能力を評価することは、難しい。
english: It's difficult to evaluate his ability.

japanese: 彼の、怒りも理解できる。
english: His anger is understandable.

japanese: 彼の、証明済みの能力は、信頼できます。
english: You can rely on his proven ability.

japanese: 彼の最新の小説は何ですか。
english: What's his most recent novel?

japanese: 彼に話す必要はなかった。
english: I didn't need to tell him.

japanese: 彼に話し掛けるほうがよいだろう。
english: It would be better for you to speak to him.

japanese: 彼に話し掛けられたときまごついてしまった。
english: I was embarrassed when he talked to me.

japanese: 彼に話しても良いよ。
english: You may speak to him.

japanese: 彼に話しても無駄である。
english: It is no use talking with him.

japanese: 彼に話しかけるのは石壁に話しかけるようなものだ。
english: You may as well talk to a stone wall as to him.

japanese: 彼の話から判断すると、彼は有能な男のようだ。
english: Judging from what he says, he seems to be a man of ability.

japanese: 彼に話しかけても無駄だ。
english: It is useless to talk to him.

japanese: 彼に話しかけられる女の子はほとんどいない。
english: Few girls can even speak to him.

japanese: 彼に連絡をとる手段が何もない。
english: There's no way to get in touch with him.

japanese: 彼に涙を見せまいと彼女は顔を背けた。
english: She turned her head away lest he see her tears.

japanese: 彼に両替を頼んだらしてくれた。
english: He accommodated me when I asked him for change.

japanese: 彼に頼めば助けてくれるだろう。
english: If you ask him, he will help you.

japanese: 彼に頼まれたことをやるより他に仕方がなかった。
english: I had no choice but to do what he asked.

japanese: 彼に来てもらう。
english: I will have him come.

japanese: 彼に来てもらえ。
english: Have him come.

japanese: 彼に来るかどうか聞いてみます。
english: I'll ask him if he will come.

japanese: 彼に有利に解釈してやれよ。
english: Give him the benefit of the doubt.

japanese: 彼に与えられた職務は市場調査だった。
english: The task assigned to him was to do marketing research.

japanese: 彼に用事があるのです。
english: I have business with him.

japanese: 彼に面会するのはたやすい。
english: He is easy to reach.

japanese: 彼に夢中なの！
english: I'm crazy about him!

japanese: 彼に本当のことを言ってほしくなかった。
english: I would rather you hadn't told him the truth.

japanese: 彼に本当のことを言うなんて君は不注意だよ。
english: It is careless of you tell him the truth.

japanese: 彼に別れを告げた。
english: I took leave of him.

japanese: 彼に別れを告げ、彼女は家を出た。
english: She said good-bye to him and left the house.

japanese: 彼に聞きなさいと言っているのだが、彼はどうしても聞こうとしない。
english: I keep telling him to listen, but he won't.

japanese: 彼に分け前を払うのは当然だ。
english: It is just that we should pay his share.

japanese: 彼に払ってもらっておいしい食事をした。
english: I had a good dinner at his expense.

japanese: 彼に腹を立ててもしかたない。
english: It is no use getting angry at him.

japanese: 彼に部屋から出て行くようにいった。
english: I told him to clear out of the room.

japanese: 彼に侮辱されたから仕返ししたい。
english: I want to get even with him for the insult.

japanese: 彼に父の持っている積極的が全然ない。
english: He has none of his father's aggressiveness.

japanese: 彼に付いて行くのも容易なことではない。
english: It's no easy task to keep up with him.

japanese: 彼に不利な判決がでた。
english: The judgement went against him.

japanese: 彼に不都合なことは何もない。
english: Nothing comes amiss to him.

japanese: 彼に必要以上の金を与えてはいけない。
english: Don't give him more money than is necessary.

japanese: 彼に必要なのはお金ではなく愛です。
english: What he needs is not money but love.

japanese: 彼に必要なだけのお金を貸してやりなさい。
english: Lend him as much money as he needs.

japanese: 彼に彼女について何も言わない方がいい。
english: You may as well tell him nothing about her.

japanese: 彼に彼はまだ重要な人物なのだということを感じさせて下さい。
english: Make him feel that he is still someone important.

japanese: 彼に反対する根拠がない。
english: He has no basis for his opposition.

japanese: 彼に破滅をもたらしたのは賭け事だった。
english: It was gambling that brought about his ruin.

japanese: 彼に任せよう。
english: Let's leave it up to him.

japanese: 彼に任せておけば大丈夫だ。
english: If you leave it to him, it'll be all right.

japanese: 彼に日本文学を紹介しようとしても意味がない。
english: There is no point in trying to introduce Japanese literature to him.

japanese: 彼に日本語が話せるかどうか聞いてごらん。
english: Ask him if he can speak Japanese.

japanese: 彼にその手紙を読んで聞かせた。
english: I read the letter to him.

japanese: 彼に同情した。
english: I felt sympathy for him.

japanese: 彼に頭を下げるのはいやだ。
english: I don't want to bow down to him.

japanese: 彼に答えを教えてはいけません。
english: Don't tell him the answer.

japanese: 彼に途中で何か間違いが起こったのでなければ良いが。
english: I hope he hasn't had an accident.

japanese: 彼に電話連絡できなかった。
english: I couldn't get him on the phone.

japanese: 彼に電話を使わせてあげなさい。
english: Let him use the telephone.

japanese: 彼に電話をしたが話中だった。
english: I tried to call him up, but the line was busy.

japanese: 彼に電話をくれるように頼んで下さい。
english: Please ask him to call me.

japanese: 彼に電話をかけるつもりだったが、考え直してやめた。
english: I was going to call him, but thought better of it.

japanese: 彼に電話をかけたがいなかった。
english: I called him up, but he wasn't there.

japanese: 彼に電話なんかしなければよかった。
english: I should have known better than to call him.

japanese: 彼に電話するのを忘れた。
english: I forget to telephone him.

japanese: 彼に電話して下さい。
english: Please call him up.

japanese: 彼に電話してみよう。
english: I'll give him a buzz.

japanese: 彼に電話してみたらどうですか。
english: Why don't you call him up?

japanese: 彼に電話したんだけど、話し中でつうじなかった。
english: I tried to call him, but the line was busy, and I couldn't get through.

japanese: 彼に電話したらどうですか。
english: Why don't you call him up?

japanese: 彼に電話したんだ。
english: I gave him a call.

japanese: 彼に電話したのですか。
english: Did you telephone him?

japanese: 彼に伝言を英語で理解させるのに苦労した。
english: I had difficulty in making him understand the message in English.

japanese: 彼に伝言を英語で理解させるのに、少なくとも３０分はかかってしまった。
english: It took me at least half an hour to get the message across to him in English.

japanese: 彼に追いつこうと全力で走った。
english: I ran as fast as possible to catch up with him.

japanese: 彼に長生きしてほしい。
english: I hope he will live long.

japanese: 彼に長い手紙を書いた。
english: I wrote a long letter to him.

japanese: 彼に丁寧な返事を書くつもりです。
english: I will write him a civil answer.

japanese: 彼に忠告しても意味がない。
english: There is no point in giving him advice.

japanese: 彼に忠告したところで、馬の耳に念仏だよ。
english: Giving advice to him is like talking to a brick wall.

japanese: 彼に遅れないように注意した。
english: I cautioned him against being late.

japanese: 彼に遅れないようにいいました。
english: I told him not to be late.

japanese: 彼に遅れたことを謝ったほうがいい。
english: You should apologize to him for coming late.

japanese: 彼に遅れずに付いて行くようにしなさい。
english: Try to keep up with him.

japanese: 彼に遅れずについていきなさい。
english: Try to keep up with him.

japanese: 彼に地図を手渡した。
english: I handed a map to him.

japanese: 彼に代わりますので少々お待ち下さい。
english: Just a minute, please. I'll call him to the phone.

japanese: 彼に代わって私が責任を負った。
english: I undertook responsibility for him.

japanese: 彼に代わってもらいます。
english: Let me put him on.

japanese: 彼に待つように言って下さい。
english: Tell him to wait.

japanese: 彼に対する態度が変わった。
english: My attitude towards him changed.

japanese: 彼に対する妻の誤解は解けなかった。
english: His wife's misunderstanding about him did not go away.

japanese: 彼に対して本当のことを言うように強くお勧めします。
english: I urge you to tell him the truth.

japanese: 彼に打診して、賛成してくれるかどうか確かめてみなさい。
english: Try sounding him out and see if he'll come around.

japanese: 彼に妥協して１００ドル貸してやった。
english: I met him halfway and lent him $100.

japanese: 私は彼に窓を開けるよう頼んだ。
english: I asked him to open the window.

japanese: 彼に早く話を終えてもらいたくてたまらなかった。
english: I was itching for him to finish his talk.

japanese: 彼に先に食事を出して下さい。
english: Please wait on him first.

japanese: 彼に窃盗の嫌疑がかかっている。
english: He is under suspicion of theft.

japanese: 彼に責められる非はないとされた。
english: He was absolved from blame.

japanese: 彼に誠意のあることは認める。
english: I admit that he is sincere.

japanese: 彼に成功の見込みはない。
english: His prospects of success are barred.

japanese: 彼に深い恩義がある。
english: I am deeply in debt to him.

japanese: 彼に真実をはなすとは彼女は正直だ。
english: It is honest of her to tell him the truth.

japanese: 彼に新しい思想を教え込んだ。
english: I impregnated his mind with new ideas.

japanese: 彼に新しい勤め口があった。
english: He got a new job.

japanese: 彼に食物をあてがった。
english: I provided him with food.

japanese: 彼に職を見つけてやった。
english: I found him a job.

japanese: 彼に詳しい具体的な指示を与えてください。
english: Please give him detailed and specific directions.

japanese: 彼に紹介する必要があれば、すぐ彼に手紙を書きましょう。
english: If you would like me to introduce you to him, I will write him right away.

japanese: 彼に小包を送った。
english: I mailed a parcel to him.

japanese: 彼に勝つことは不可能だ。
english: He is impossible to beat.

japanese: 彼に助力を求めてもあまり役に立たない。
english: There's little merit in asking him for help.

japanese: 彼に助言を与えるだけでなく金も与えた。
english: I not only gave him some advice, I gave him some money.

japanese: 彼に助言を求めてはいかがですか。
english: Why don't we ask his advice?

japanese: 彼に助言をしておきました。
english: I gave him some helpful advice.

japanese: 彼に助けを頼んでごらん。
english: You can ask him for help.

japanese: 彼に助けを求めるのはいい考えだ。
english: It is a good idea asking him for help.

japanese: 彼に助けを求めるなんて彼女は愚かだった。
english: It was foolish of her to ask him for help.

japanese: 彼に助けを求めることは彼女のプライドが許さなかった。
english: She was too proud to ask him for help.

japanese: 彼に助けを求めても無駄だ。
english: It's no use asking him for help.

japanese: 彼に書類を手渡すつもりであったが、忘れてしまった。
english: I intended to hand the paper to him, but I forgot to.

japanese: 彼に酒を飲ませないようにすることはできない。
english: You cannot prevent him from drinking.

japanese: 彼に手紙を受け取ったことを知らせましたか。
english: Did you acknowledge his letter?

japanese: 彼に質問した後で彼のいいたかったことが明確になった。
english: After I asked him a question, what he meant was clarified.

japanese: 彼に辞職するように求める必要は無かった。
english: We didn't need to ask him to resign.

japanese: 彼に自分の意見を述べさせよ。
english: Let him have his say.

japanese: 彼に事実を話す事が大切だと思います。
english: I think it is important to tell him the facts.

japanese: 彼が事故にあったことを我々は知った。
english: We learned that he had an accident.

japanese: 彼に私の部屋を掃除させた。
english: I got him to clean my room.

japanese: 彼に私の時計を修理してもらった。
english: I got him to mend my watch.

japanese: 彼に私の家にペンキを塗ってもらった。
english: I had him paint my house.

japanese: 彼に私の英語は通じなかった。
english: I couldn't make him understand my English.

japanese: 彼に私が正しいと納得させるには長くかかった。
english: It took a long time for me to convince him that I was right.

japanese: 彼に私から電話があったことをお伝えいただけますか。
english: Will you tell him I called?

japanese: 彼に思うとおりにさせてやれ。
english: Let him go his own way.

japanese: 彼に初めて会った時の事をよく覚えています。
english: I remember well the time I first met him.

japanese: 彼に初めて会ったのは3年前です。
english: I first met him three years ago.

japanese: 彼に財産管理を任せた。
english: I entrusted my property to him.

japanese: 彼に賛成するように説得しようとしても無駄だ。
english: It is useless to try to persuade him to agree.

japanese: 彼に災いあれ。
english: Woe betide him!

japanese: 彼に後の仕事を任せて外出した。
english: I left the rest to him and went out.

japanese: 彼に好きなことをしてもよいと許可を与えた。
english: I have given leave to do what he likes.

japanese: 彼に枯れ葉を取り除くように言ってください。
english: Please tell him to get rid of the dead leaves.

japanese: 彼に言い聞かせよう。
english: Let's give him a stern talking to.

japanese: 彼に言い分を言わせよう。
english: Let him have his say.

japanese: 彼に言いたい事を言わせておけ。
english: Let him say what he will.

japanese: 彼に現地の情報を教えてくださるよう、お願いいたします。
english: I would be grateful if you could give him some information on local conditions.

japanese: 彼に厳しい訓練を与えなさい。
english: Give him rigid training.

japanese: 彼に見られなくて幸いだった。
english: Luckily he did not see me.

japanese: 彼に鍵を渡したことを覚えている。
english: I remember giving him the key.

japanese: 彼に決心を変える気にさせる事はできなかった。
english: Nothing could induce him to change his mind.

japanese: 彼に決心を変えるように説得するのは難しかった。
english: It was difficult to persuade him to change his mind.

japanese: 彼に欠点があるのでなおさら彼が好きだ。
english: I like him the better for his faults.

japanese: 彼に欠点があるから、それだけ一層彼が好きなのだ。
english: I like him all the better for his faults.

japanese: 彼に警察へ行くよう忠告しましたか。
english: Did you advise him to go to the police?

japanese: 彼に計画の概略を述べてもらおう。
english: Ask him to sketch out his plan.

japanese: 彼に君の名を言っておきました。
english: I mentioned your name to him.

japanese: 彼に君のギターを弾かせなさい。
english: Let him play your guitar.

japanese: 彼に靴を修理させよう。
english: I will have him mend my shoes.

japanese: 彼に銀行に行かせよう。
english: He shall go to the bank.

japanese: 彼に金を貸すとは君もばかだね。
english: It is stupid of you to lend him your money.

japanese: 彼に金を貸すなんて僕はなんと愚かだったのだろう。
english: What a fool I was to lend him the money.

japanese: 彼に金を貸すぐらいなら海に捨てた方がましだ。
english: You might just as well throw your money into the sea as lend it to him.

japanese: 彼に金を貸してやるくらいなら海に捨てた方がましだよ。
english: You might just as well throw your money into the sea as lend it to him.

japanese: 彼に金を貸してあげて君はとても親切だった。
english: It was very kind of you to lend him some money.

japanese: 彼に金を貸したらダメだってことを分かっていようものを。
english: You should have known better than to lend him money.

japanese: 彼に金をやるくらいならむしろどぶに捨てた方がましだ。
english: You had as well throw your money into the ditch as give it to him.

japanese: 彼に金の支払いを要求した。
english: I demanded that he should pay.

japanese: 彼に近づくよう合図した。
english: I signed for him to approach.

japanese: 彼に休暇中にどこへ行く計画なのか聞いてみよう。
english: I'll ask him where he is planning to go during the vacation.

japanese: 彼に休むよう忠告した。
english: I advised him to take a rest.

japanese: 彼に逆らうと後悔するぞ。
english: Don't cross him or you'll regret it.

japanese: 彼に逆らうな。
english: Don't oppose him.

japanese: 彼に喫煙の習慣がついた。
english: He acquired the habit of smoking.

japanese: 彼に起こった種々の不幸に加えて息子が急死した。
english: To add to his difficulties his son died a sudden death.

japanese: 彼に気力がない。
english: He is no longer full of activity.

japanese: 彼に機先を制された。
english: He had the jump on me.

japanese: 彼に機嫌を損ねられて実に遺憾だった。
english: I found it truly regrettable that he should take offence.

japanese: 彼に関する限り、ものごとはうまく行っていた。
english: So far as he was concerned, things were going well.

japanese: 彼に干渉するな。
english: Don't meddle in his affairs.

japanese: 彼に学校に遅れないように言いなさい。
english: Tell him not to be late for school.

japanese: 彼に会わなかったのだろう。
english: You didn't see him.

japanese: 彼に会って初めて彼女はその情報を知った。
english: She didn't know the information till she met him.

japanese: 彼に会ったらよろしく言っといてください。
english: In case you see him, give him my regards.

japanese: 彼に会ったらよろしく言ってください。
english: In case you see him, please say hello to him for me.

japanese: 彼に会ったのはこれで２度目です。
english: This is the second time that I have met him.

japanese: 彼に会ったとたんに、彼が私に腹を立てていることがわかった。
english: The moment I saw him, I knew he was angry with me.

japanese: 彼に会ったことを覚えている。
english: I remember seeing him.

japanese: 彼に会えるかもしれないよ。
english: You may catch him.

japanese: 彼に会う前にピサロは町の近くに部下と銃をたくさん隠した。
english: Before meeting him, Pizarro hid many of his men and guns near the town.

japanese: 彼に会う事などは到底思いもよらない。
english: I cannot think that I will ever meet him.

japanese: 彼に会う事ができなかった。
english: I was not able to see him.

japanese: 彼に会う機会を見送った。
english: I passed up an opportunity to see him.

japanese: 彼に会う機会さえあればなあ。
english: If only I get a chance to see him.

japanese: 彼に会うのはこの次にしましょう。
english: I will meet him some other time.

japanese: 彼に会うたびごとに、彼の頭の良さに圧倒された。
english: Every time I saw him, I was overcome with his brilliance.

japanese: 彼に会うたびに私はとても幸せな気持ちになる。
english: Every time I meet him, I feel so happy.

japanese: 彼に会うといつも、とても楽しい気分になる。
english: Every time I meet him, I feel so happy.

japanese: 彼に会うことは出来ますか。
english: Can you meet him?

japanese: 彼に会いに行ったが、留守だった。
english: I went to see him, but he was out.

japanese: 彼に会いたいと電話した。
english: I telephoned to say that I wanted to see him.

japanese: 彼に会いたいものだ。
english: I would like to meet him.

japanese: 彼に我が道を行かせてやれ。
english: Let him go his own way.

japanese: 彼に会いたいと思っている。
english: I'm longing to see him.

japanese: 彼は過ちをあからさまに白状した。
english: He openly confessed his faults.

japanese: 彼に荷物を運んでもらった。
english: I had him carry my baggage.

japanese: 彼に花を持たせてやった。
english: I let him get the credit.

japanese: 彼に家を売るつもりですか。
english: Will you sell your house to him?

japanese: 彼に家業を継ぐようにときつけた。
english: I persuaded him to take on the family business.

japanese: 彼に何をするつもりかたずねた。
english: I asked what he was going to do.

japanese: 彼に何が欲しいのか尋ねた。
english: I inquired what he wanted.

japanese: 彼に何があったのか話してください。
english: Please tell me what happened to him.

japanese: 彼に応急処置をお願いします。
english: Can you give him first aid?

japanese: 彼に援助を頼んでも無駄だよ。
english: There is no use in asking him for assistance.

japanese: 彼に援助を求めるだけでいい。
english: You have only to ask for his help.

japanese: 彼に駅までの道を聞きなさい。
english: Ask him the way to the station.

japanese: 彼に英語で話しかけたが理解してもらえなかった。
english: I spoke to him in English, but I couldn't make myself understood.

japanese: 彼に泳ぎ方を教えた。
english: I taught him how to swim.

japanese: 彼に嘘など付かなければよかった。
english: It was good if the lie wasn't added to him.

japanese: 彼に嘘などつかなければよかった。二度と彼の顔をまともに見られない。
english: I wish I hadn't lied to him. I'll never be able to look him in the face again.

japanese: 彼に一矢を報いてやった。
english: I took a swing at him.

japanese: 彼に一番迷惑をかけたのは彼の息子だ。
english: His son troubled him most.

japanese: 彼に一人で会うとは彼女もいい度胸だ。
english: She must have some nerve to go and meet him by herself.

japanese: 彼に一人でそれをさせてはいけません。
english: Don't let him do it alone.

japanese: 彼に一言忠告してあげなさい。
english: Give him a piece of advice.

japanese: 彼に一曲歌って欲しい。
english: I want him to sing a song.

japanese: 彼に以前どこかで会った記憶がある。
english: I remember having seen him somewhere before.

japanese: 彼に悪評がたっている。
english: There is a scandal about him.

japanese: 彼にわかるように、彼女は両手を振りました。
english: She waved both her hands so that he could find her.

japanese: 彼によろしくお伝えください。
english: Please say hello to him for me.

japanese: 彼によろしくお伝え下さい。
english: Please give him my best regards.

japanese: 彼によればその案は完璧にはほど遠い。
english: In his opinion, the plan is far from perfect.

japanese: 彼によって何が言われましたか。
english: What was said by him?

japanese: 彼によく会いますか。
english: Do you see him often?

japanese: よくあることだが、彼は今日も授業に遅れた。
english: As is often the case with him, he was late for class today.

japanese: 彼にユーモアのセンスがないのは残念だ。
english: It is a pity that he has no sense of humor.

japanese: 彼にやらせてみよう。
english: We will let him try.

japanese: 彼にやらせておけ。
english: Let him at it.

japanese: 彼にもわかるように、私達も英語で話した方がいいですね。
english: It's probably a good idea for us to speak in English, so he'll be able to understand.

japanese: 彼にもビールを持ってきて。
english: Please bring him his beer.

japanese: 彼にもっと早く出発したほうがいいと勧めた。
english: I advised him to start earlier.

japanese: 彼にもそれなりに恐いものがある。
english: He has his own collection of phobias.

japanese: 彼にもしものことがあったら教えて下さい。
english: If anything happens to him, let me know.

japanese: 彼にもう少しいるように頼んでごらん。
english: Ask him to stay a while.

japanese: 彼にもう一杯いかがかと問う。
english: Ask if he wants another drink.

japanese: 彼にもう一度頼んでも無駄だ。
english: It is no use asking him again.

japanese: 彼にもうこれ以上飲まさないようにしなければいけない。
english: We have to stop him from drinking any more.

japanese: 彼にもうクリスマスカードを送りましたか。
english: Have you sent him a Christmas card yet?

japanese: 彼にひとつ頼みごとをしました。
english: I asked a favor of him.

japanese: 彼にひとつ買うように納得されるのに、君ならなんと言いますか。
english: What would you say to convince him to buy one?

japanese: 彼にひどい目に合わされた。
english: He gave me a hard time.

japanese: 彼にひどい風邪をうつされた。
english: He gave me a bad cold.

japanese: 彼には話しかける友人がいなかった。
english: He had no friend to talk to.

japanese: 彼には話さない方がいいよ。
english: You'd better not tell him.

japanese: 彼には劣等感があるね。
english: He has an inferiority complex.

japanese: 彼には緑と青の区別がつかなかった。
english: He couldn't tell green from blue.

japanese: 彼には良い計画を立てる能力がある。
english: He has the ability to make a good plan.

japanese: 彼には頼れる友人がいない。
english: He has no friends to fall back on.

japanese: 彼には立派な息子が２人いる。
english: He has two beautiful boys.

japanese: 彼には来年外国へ行く計画がある。
english: He has a plan to go abroad next year.

japanese: 彼には養わなければならない大家族がある。
english: He has a large family to support.

japanese: 彼には養わなければならない家族はいない。
english: He has no family to support.

japanese: 彼には養うべき大家族がある。
english: He has a large family to provide for.

japanese: 彼には養うべき家族がいる。
english: He has a family to support.

japanese: 彼には洋々たる前途があった。
english: A brilliant future lay before him.

japanese: 彼には容易に政治家としての態度が見うけられる。
english: You can easily see the politician in him.

japanese: 彼には友達が一人もいない。
english: He doesn't have any friends.

japanese: 彼には友情というもののよさが理解できない。
english: He cannot appreciate friendship.

japanese: 彼には勇気が欠けている。
english: He is lacking in courage.

japanese: 彼には役職がついている。
english: He has a position.

japanese: 彼には夜更かしの癖がある。
english: He is in the habit of staying up late at night.

japanese: 彼には娘は目にいれても痛くない。
english: His daughter is very dear to him.

japanese: 彼には娘が二人あり、両方とも医者と結婚しています。
english: He has two daughters, both of whom are married to doctors.

japanese: 彼には娘が三人いる。ひとりは結婚しているが、残りは結婚していない。
english: He has three daughters; one is married, but the others aren't.

japanese: 彼には娘が３人いる。１人は結婚しているが、あと２人は結婚していない。
english: He has three daughters; one is married, but the others aren't.

japanese: 彼には娘が２人いて、２人とも結婚している。
english: He has two daughters, who are married.

japanese: 彼には妹がいる。そして彼女もまた学校に行っている。
english: He has a sister and she goes to school, too.

japanese: 彼には本当にはっとさせられた。
english: He gave me quite a start.

japanese: 彼には本当にいらいらさせられる。
english: He really gets across me.

japanese: 彼には僕に話したい緊急の知らせがあった。
english: He had some urgent news to tell me.

japanese: 彼には弁護士の資格がある。
english: He is qualified as a solicitor.

japanese: 彼には弁護士になった息子が３人いた。
english: He had three sons who became lawyers.

japanese: 彼には勉強する部屋がない。
english: He has no room to study in.

japanese: 彼には片親の家族に対する同情が全くない。
english: He has no sympathy for single parent families.

japanese: 彼には片親の家族に対する同情がない。
english: He has no sympathy for single parent families.

japanese: 彼には武力と財力がある。
english: He has swords and purse.

japanese: 彼には父親の借金を支払う義務があった。
english: He was bound to pay his father's debt.

japanese: 彼には扶養家族が多かった。
english: He had a large family to support.

japanese: 彼には扶養すべき大家族がある。
english: He has a large family to provide for.

japanese: 彼には富と言う強みがある。
english: He has the advantage of wealth.

japanese: 彼には不平の種なんか一つもない。
english: He's got nothing to grouse about.

japanese: 彼には必要なだけの金がなかった。
english: He did not have enough money.

japanese: 彼には必需品すらない、まして贅沢品はなおさらだ。
english: He has no daily necessities, much less luxuries.

japanese: 彼には匹敵するものがない。
english: He is without parallel.

japanese: 彼には美しい奥さんがあるにもかかわらず、その割りには喜んでいない。
english: He is none the happier for his beautiful wife.

japanese: 彼には彼女の忠告のありがたみが理解できなかった。
english: He could not comprehend the value of her advice.

japanese: 彼には彼女の親切がわからない。
english: He is blind to her kindness.

japanese: 彼には彼女のハートを射止める見込みはないだろう。
english: He will have no chance of winning her heart.

japanese: 彼には彼女に反論する立派な言い分がある。
english: He has a good case against her.

japanese: 彼には犯した罪の責任がある。
english: He will answer for his crimes.

japanese: 彼には反対する根拠がない。
english: He has no basis for his opposition.

japanese: 彼には俳優になる才能がない。
english: He lacks the talent to be an actor.

japanese: 彼には農業の経験がありますか。
english: Has he got any experience of farming?

japanese: 彼には熱烈な支持者が大勢いる。
english: He has many enthusiastic supporters.

japanese: 彼には日常必需品すらない、まして贅沢品はあるわけがない。
english: He has no daily necessities, much less luxuries.

japanese: 彼には二度と会わなかったが、私はそれを残念とも思わなかった。
english: I never saw him again, nor did I regret it.

japanese: 彼には二度と会いたくないんです。
english: I don't want to see him again.

japanese: 彼には二人の息子がいたが、彼らは医者になった。
english: He had two sons, who became doctors.

japanese: 彼には特別賞が与えられた。
english: He was awarded a special prize.

japanese: 彼には道徳観念が欠けている。
english: He lacks moral sense.

japanese: 彼には電車に乗って帰るだけのお金がなかった。
english: He didn't have enough money to ride home on the train.

japanese: 彼には天賦の才がある。
english: He has natural gifts.

japanese: 彼には弟がいる、そして東京に住んでいる。
english: He has a brother who lives in Tokyo.

japanese: 彼には昼頃会いました。
english: I met him about noon.

japanese: 彼には知性がある。
english: He is possessed of intelligence.

japanese: 彼には知人は多いが友人は少ない。
english: He has many acquaintances but few friends.

japanese: 彼には知識があり、また経験もある。
english: He has knowledge and experience as well.

japanese: 彼には大好きな自分の娯楽に夢中になる時間があった。
english: He had time to lose himself in his favorite amusement.

japanese: 彼には大きな計画を遂行する能力がある。
english: He has the ability to carry out big plans.

japanese: 彼には多少経済学の知識がある。
english: He has a knowledge of economics.

japanese: 彼には多くの才能がある。
english: He's a man of many talents.

japanese: 彼には他の者に分けてやれるだけの食べ物はなかった。
english: He never had enough food to give to someone else.

japanese: 彼には息子が二人いたが、二人とも教師になった。
english: He had two sons, who both became teachers.

japanese: 彼には息子が３人いて、みんな医者になった。
english: He had three sons, who all became doctors.

japanese: 彼には息子が３人あって、みな音楽家になった。
english: He has three sons, who became musicians.

japanese: 彼には息子が２人いるが、２人とも商人になった。
english: He has two sons, who became merchants.

japanese: 彼には総理大臣になりたいという野心があった。
english: He had the ambition to be prime minister.

japanese: 彼には素晴らしいユーモアのセンスがある。
english: He has a great sense of humour.

japanese: 彼には全く腹が立った。
english: I was very much annoyed with him.

japanese: 彼には善悪の区別がつかないんだ。
english: He can't tell right from wrong.

japanese: 彼には前に会ったことがない。
english: I haven't met him before.

japanese: 彼には先生も匙を投げている。
english: He is his teachers' despair.

japanese: 彼には精神障害が有る。
english: He is mentally handicapped.

japanese: 彼には生物学の知識が多少ある。
english: He has a knowledge of biology.

japanese: 彼には生活していくだけの年金がある。
english: He has a pension to live on.

japanese: 彼には正直のかけらもない。
english: He does not have a particle of honesty in him.

japanese: 彼には数回会ったことがある。
english: I've met him on several occasions.

japanese: 彼には人間的な感情がまったくかけている。
english: He is devoid of human feeling.

japanese: 彼には親切心などみじんもない。
english: He doesn't have a particle of kindness in his heart.

japanese: 彼には紳士らしいところがまるでない。
english: He is nothing of a gentleman.

japanese: 彼には真実を話す勇気がない。
english: He hasn't the nerve to tell the truth.

japanese: 彼には神秘的なところがある。
english: He has an air of mystery about him.

japanese: 彼には新車を買うゆとりがない。
english: He can't afford a new car.

japanese: 彼には心配事がない。
english: He is free from care.

japanese: 彼には審美眼がない。
english: He has no eye for beautiful.

japanese: 彼には審美眼がある。
english: He has an eye for the beautiful.

japanese: 彼には常識が欠けている。
english: He is devoid of common sense.
